justification: The AES was used as one of the self-report questionnaire measures of apathy, helping to identify apathetic traits among participants and link these traits to specific behaviors in the Traffic Light Task.
The AMI was used alongside the AES to measure apathy, providing a more comprehensive evaluation of apathetic traits, which were subsequently correlated with behavioral outcomes in the study.
The BIS-11 was employed to assess impulsivity by measuring impulsive traits among participants, which were then associated with specific response patterns in the experimental task.

measured_by: Urgency, Premeditation, Perseverance, Sensation Seeking, Positive Urgency, Impulsive Behavior Scale (UPPS-P)
justification: The UPPS-P questionnaire was utilized to assess different facets of impulsivity, such as urgency, premeditation, and sensation seeking, linking these aspects to behavioral performance.
Fatigue ratings were collected using a VAS throughout the experimental session to track the development of subjective fatigue, which was analyzed alongside apathy and impulsivity traits.
